title: Predict precipitation of Ag+ and Pb2+ with K2SO4

content.question: A 1.0 L solution AgNO3(ag) of and Pb(NO3)2(aq) has a Ag+ concentration of 0.020 M and a Pb2+ concentration of 0.0010 M. A 0.0010 mol sample of K2SO4(s) is added to the solution. Based on the information in the table above, which of the following will occur? (Assume that the volume change of the solution is negligible.)

choices.label: Both Ag2SO4(s) and PbSO4(s) will precipitate.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
